official-title.#text:
Providing for consideration of the bill
		  (H.R. 1960) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2014 for military
		  activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to
		  prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other
		  purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1256) to direct the
		  Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission
		  to jointly adopt rules setting forth the application to cross-border swaps
		  transactions of certain provisions relating to swaps that were enacted as part
		  of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection
		  Act.

committee-name.#tail:
,
			 reported the following resolution; which was referred to the House Calendar and
			 ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may, pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XVIII, declare the House resolved into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for consideration of the bill (
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2014 for military activities of the

and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes. The first reading of the bill shall be dispensed with. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. General debate shall be confined to the bill and shall not exceed one hour equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
. After general debate, the Committee of the Whole shall rise without motion. No further consideration of the bill shall be in order except pursuant to a subsequent order of the

text.#text: That at any time after the adoption of this resolution the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to jointly adopt rules setting forth the application to cross-border swaps transactions of certain provisions relating to swaps that were enacted as part of the
. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. The amendments recommended by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as read. All points of order against provisions in the bill, as amended, are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bill, as amended, and on any amendment thereto to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate, with 40 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
and 20 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
; and (2) one motion to recommit with or without instructions.

text.#text: Upon the adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to consider in the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 256 RH: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1960) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2014 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1256) to direct the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to jointly adopt rules setting forth the application to cross-border swaps transactions of certain provisions relating to swaps that were enacted as part of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.
